title: I just like to point out how Riot successfully forced Dynamic Q on the community
body:
They've successfully ignored us long enough that everyone has given up asking for it

*Slow Clap Riot* Now they know that can do that with anything the community doesn't like. 


What are you guys going to do? Quit the game?

replies.body:
This entire pre season has been an utter disaster.

"Riot death timers are too long, it makes games super stompy"  
Riot response: Nah working as intended guys. 5 months later they finally decide to reduce them

"Riot towers are weak, they dont do damage and die too fast, diving is too easy"
Riot response: Nah towers are stronger than ever. 5 months later they finally decide to buff them

"Riot dynamic queue ruins the solo queue experience and trivializes the ranking system"
Riot response: Nah our stats show that 90% of people love dynamic queue its the best.


I just find it hilarious how they community notices the flaws in their changes almost immediately and yet they refuse to listen only to do backtrack months down the line.
Riots incapable of making any kind of balance change without humping excel spreadsheets for months until it can verify what everyone already knows.

Good thing that you know what's wrong by feel, while Riot needs data to make that change.
I'm pretty sure they can take your approach and guess that your favorite champion could potentially be OP in the future and then put him/her in a wheelchair just because.

Then you'd be here complaining how Riot hands out nerfs based their feelings and how that's unprofessional for a company.
But then again, now you're complaining that they need data and that not every time is apparent what's going to happen, even if you make a guess by having a feeling.

when a building is on fire I don't need to wait for the data on how hot it is or how much its going to burn down/how much damage it causes before I'd want to put it out. 

Maybe you and riot do. I dunno, seems silly tho. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

No, you're the one who's pretending that the building is on fire.
And then once something catches fire, you then say "i told ya so, this can burn".
You're never specific about what you complain about, you just point your finger at the problem and it's up to Riot to figure out why that is.
Sometimes that's pretty easy to discern and sometimes it isn't.

Word your arguments differently in the future - you're not against them acting and making changes based on data. You wouldn't like it one bit if they took your advice and started making changes based on how they might feel in the future, with no data to back it up.
**Or did you forget what the term "olafing" and "sejuani'd" means?**
These are one of the examples of Riot taking the initiative before the problem was identified and as i remember, the community backlash was the same as now.

##What you're arguing about is why is it taking so long to make these changes.
I'm not defending them, i'm pointing you in the right direction, since you don't seem to know on which door to knock.
How would you know which door to direct me to if you haven't gotten 6 months of feedback first bro :^)

Personally I still enjoy playing the game solo and I also think reports of 3 man jungle invades are extremely exaggerated; people also forget 4 man botlane gangbangs have been happening for years. Granted I've never been higher than Gold, but from my anecdotal experience people rarely use communication to its full effect in low elo (which is like 85% of games). IMO dyanamic queue is fine and doesn't impact my games but I understand others feel differently.

The worst part of it imo is not any of those things, but premade toxicity.

If you do badly and 1 player starts flaming you, their entire premade will gang up on you and constantly flame you and defend their buddy the entire game. I've also had them spam alert pings on me in a synchronized fashion for the entire game and refuse to help me in-game no matter what. (eg; their midlaner and jungler 2v1 me at scuttlecrab, our mid sees what's happening but purposely ignores me because their premade friend doesn't like me.).

It sounds like Riot's is playing a dangerous game of Chicken. They either have to fix Dynamic Q, or create Solo Q before everyone jumps ship. 

Though it does sound like they arn't completely abandoning Solo Players, but rather saying they need more time. Personally, I'm patient, and can wait for riot to make an informed decision, rather than try and rush them.

And they are probably right about people falling in love with the new Q. So if there really is no way to fix ranked integrity, they could still maintain Dynamic Q in normals.

This work for something in economics called "the investment theorm". Which suggest the more value you put into something the hard it would be for you to let go.[taking it to the extreme is when someone sees his house on fine and decides to try and save it even if it's hopeless]

They knew that even if older players were effectively rejecting DQ, they wouldn't quit for a while and that will give Riot enough time to experiment and find a solution while most of the playerbase is still intact. However with DQ being a thing for 4+ months now, i can see them running out of time.

They _might_ be trying to create a system that can support both.

Might.
I can't see how they'd do that without massively inflating queue times, though.

I haven't quit but I have been playing **A LOT** less. I was gold in seasons 4 and 5 and had a couple ranked teams floating around in silver. I played several games almost every day. But now I play 1 game every 3 days or so. Always with friends and always a normal game. No more ranked for me until solo queue is here. I've also stopped buying RP in season 6.

In the meantime, I've been in the Overwatch beta so I've been enjoying that. No solo queue in that game either but it's a closed beta so there probably isn't a population to support it yet. After the beta goes down next week, I've got a few games in my Steam catalog to go through, Far Cry 4 primarily.

Dynamic queue has really soured this game for me. I actually was for it when it was introduced but its flaws have become very apparent and I don't like Riot's attitude towards criticism of it.

First lie, then soften the lie, then make excuses, then pretend the issue doesn't exist. Always, always works.

And yeah, I've quit playing. But Riot really doesn't care if a few people quit.

Idk if you can say they successfully forced it, because it's pretty much impossible for the community to resist.

This is the case for every game dev. verse their community. It's their game, you can dislike the changes and rally against them you want, but if they want to make these kinds of changes you have no control over it.

It's stupid because it shows a complete disconnect from their own fan base which is exactly what happened and is still occurring in WoW... but i guess we will see if they kill their own game or if they get lucky and find a new audience while retaining enough of their current one.
